controversies: Class-action lawsuit in California alleging denial of minimum wages and failure to compensate drivers
Scrutiny from the California Air Resources Board over environmental practices
environmental_issues: Compliance with climate change and greenhouse gas emission regulations
Reliance on fossil fuels for fleet and refrigeration units
social_issues: Ongoing driver shortage impacting operational efficiency
Labor disputes and allegations of wage violations
governance_issues: Legal challenges and potential financial penalties from lawsuits
Need for improved compliance with labor and environmental regulations

sources.snippet: Marten Transport Ltd is a temperature-sensitive truckload carrier in the United States. sources.title: ESG & sustainability info for Marten Transport, Ltd. | ESG Ratings
sources.snippet: Marten Transport, Ltd., with headquarters in Mondovi, Wisconsin, is a supplier of time- and temperature-sensitive transportation and distribution services to customers in the United States, Canada and Mexico. Founded in 1946 and public since 1986, Marten employs more than 2,600 people and works with nearly 400 contractors. The company maintains terminals in Indiana, Oregon, Georgia and California.
